sign-in.title: Public Sector Employee
sign-in.description: Use your {{accountType}} account to authenticate to Digital Marketplace.

sign-up.description: Providers must have an {{accountType}} account in order to authenticate to Digital Marketplace.

select.description: Choose the account that best suits you. Access to certain features of the application depends on the type of account you select.
select.title: Choose an account type

vendor.title: Sign in
vendor.description: Select one of the options available below to sign in to your Digital Marketplace account.

account.title: Welcome to Digital marketplace
account.description: Please login to access your Digital Marketplace account.

landing.body: The Government Digital Marketplace is a new platform that helps build an ecosystem of innovation and collaboration between technology entrepreneurs and the Quebec government.
landing.info:
Join a community of developers, entrepreneurs and innovators
and innovators to participate in the development of public service technology development.

develop.title: Develop With Us
develop.description:
Get paid
to submit code.

Opportunities up to 70 000 $

co-create.title: Co-create With Us
co-create.description:
Provide an Agile team to work with a government product
manager in a modern DevOps environment.

Opportunities up to 2 000 000$.

gov-role-info.title: Public Service Employees
gov-role-info.header: Work with talented and skilled developers to create your digital products.

role-one.description: Select the program that suits your needs, post your opportunity and wait for proposals to arrive.

role-two.header: View and manage your published opportunities
role-two.description: View a complete history of your published opportunities where you can review and evaluate all proposals received, award the opportunity to the successful bidder and more.

vendor-role-info.title: Suppliers
vendor-role-info.header: Collaborate with the public service to create innovative digital products.

role-one.description: Save a draft of your proposal until you are ready to submit it.

role-two.header: View and export your submitted proposals
role-two.description: View all past and pending submissions. You will be able to see your scores and rankings once submitted.

bottom-view.description:
Discover the latest opportunities in
digital marketplace

one.title: Requirements
one.description: To qualify to submit proposals for Sprint With Us opportunities, your organization must meet the following requirements:

one.name: At least two team members.
one.description: Add team members from the "Team" tab to begin the process of satisfying this requirement.

two.name: Team members collectively possess all capabilities.
two.description: Your team members can choose their capabilities on their user profiles.

two.title: Terms & Conditions
two.description: View the {{swuTermsTitle}} by clicking the button below.

team.title: Team Members
team.description: Add team members to your organization by clicking on the "Add Team Member(s)" button above. Please ensure team members have already signed up for a Digital Marketplace Vendor account before adding them to your organization.
team.capabilities-description: This is a summary of the capabilities your organization's team possesses as whole, only including the capabilities of confirmed (non-pending) members. Team members can claim capabilities in their user profiles in the "Capabilities" section.
team.add-email-info: Provide an email address for each team member to invite them to join your organization.
team.add-email-description: Please ensure team members have already signed up for a Digital Marketplace Vendor account before adding them to your organization, and only enter the email addresses associated with their Digital Marketplace accounts.
team.remove-membre-info: Are you sure you want to remove {{userName}} from this organization?
team.removeMembreBody: Are you sure you want to remove {{userName}} from this organization?

links.become-qualified: apply to become a Qualified Supplier.

notification.anyQuestion: If you have any questions, please send an email to {{email}}.

form.avatar-error: Please select a different avatar image.

agile-coaching.title: Agile Coaching
descriptions: Embed an Agile culture using techniques from a wide range or Agile and lean methodologies and frameworks, while being methodology agnostic
Help create an open and trust-based environment, which enables a focus on delivery and facilitates continuous improvement
Assess the culture of a team and delivery processes in place to identify improvements and facilitate these improvements with the right type of support
Showcase relevant tools and techniques such as coaching, advising, workshops, and mentoring
Engage with stakeholders at all levels of an organization
Develop clear lines of escalation, in agreement with senior managers
Ensure any stakeholder can easily find out an accurate and current project or program status, without disruption to delivery

Apply best tools and techniques to: team roles, behaviours, structure and culture, Agile ceremonies and practices, knowledge transfer and sharing, program management, cross-team coordination, and overall governance of digital service delivery
Ensure key metrics and requirements that support the team and delivery are well defined and maintained
Equip staff with the ability to coach others
Provide executive coaching on the fundamental considerations of digital service delivery design

backend-development.title: Backend Development
descriptions: Web development using open-source web programming languages (e.g., Ruby, Python) and frameworks (e.g., Django, Rails)
Develop and consume web-based, RESTful APIs
Use and work in team environments that use Agile methodologies (e.g., Scrum, Lean)
Author developer-friendly documentation (e.g., API documentation, deployment operations)
Test-driven development
Use version control systems, specifically Git and GitHub
Quickly research and learn new programming tools and techniques
Work with relational and non-relational database systems
Use scalable search technology (e.g. ElasticSearch, Solr)
Handle large data sets and scaling their handling and storage
Use and work with open source solutions and community
Communicate technical concepts to a non-technical audience

delivery-management.title: Delivery Management
descriptions: Deliver projects and products using the appropriate Agile project management methodology, learning & iterating frequently
Work with  product managers to define the roadmap for any given product and translating this into user stories
Lead the collaborative, dynamic planning process – prioritizing the work that needs to be done against the capacity and capability of the team
Matrix-manage a multi-disciplinary team
Ensure all products are built to an appropriate level of quality for the stage (alpha/beta/implementation)
Actively and openly share knowledge of best practices

devOps-engineering.title: DevOps Engineering
descriptions: Deploy and configure services using infrastructure as a service providers (e.g., Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Compute Engine, RackSpace/OpenStack)
Configure and manage Linux-based servers to serve a dynamic website
Debug cluster-based computing architectures
Use scripting or basic programming skills to solve problems
Install and manage open source monitoring tools
Configure management tools (e.g., Puppet, Chef, Ansible, Salt)
Create architecture for continuous integration and deployment, and continuous monitoring
Use containerization technologies (e.g., LXC, Docker, Rocket)

frontend-development.title: Frontend Development
descriptions: Frontend web development using modern techniques and frameworks (e.g., HTML5, CSS3, CSS frameworks like LESS and SASS, Responsive Design, Bourbon, Twitter Bootstrap)

JavaScript development using modern standards, including strict mode compliance, modularization techniques and tools, and frameworks and libraries (e.g., jQuery, MV* frameworks such as Backbone.js and Ember.js, D3)
Consume RESTful APIs
Use and work in team environments that use Agile methodologies (e.g., Scrum, Lean)
Use version control systems, specifically Git and GitHub
Quickly research and learn new programming tools and techniques
Use and work with open source solutions and community
Create web layouts from static images
Create views and templates in full-stack frameworks like Rails, Express, or Django

security-engineering.title: Security Engineering
descriptions: Perform security audits, risk analysis, application-level vulnerability testing, and security code reviews
Develop and implement technical solutions to help mitigate security vulnerabilities
Conduct research to identify new attack vectors

technical-architecture.title: Technical Architecture
descriptions: Architect the overall system, by using prototyping and proof of concepts, which may include: modern programming languages (e.g., Ruby, Python, Node.js) and web frameworks (e.g., Django, Rails); modern front-end web programming techniques (e.g., HTML5, CSS3, RESTful APIs) and frameworks (e.g., Twitter Bootstrap, jQuery); relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL), and “NoSQL” databases (e.g., Cassandra, MongoDB); automated configuration management (e.g., Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Salt), continuous integration/deployment, and continuous monitoring solutions
Use version control systems, specifically Git and GitHub
Ensure strategic alignment of technical design and architecture to meet business growth and direction, and stay on top of emerging technologies
Deconstruct business and system architecture to support clean-interface multi-team development
Develop product roadmaps, backlogs, and measurable success criteria, and writing user stories (i.e., can establish a path to delivery for breaking down stories)
Clearly communicate and work with stakeholders at every level

user-experience-design.title: User Experience Design
descriptions: Use and work in team environments that use Agile methodologies (e.g., Scrum, Lean)
Build consensus with a product team on features that will meet business goals and deliver value to users
Turn user-centered design heuristics and user research into product designs
Represent product designs visually from low- to -high fidelity as needed
Work effectively with developers to implement designs accurately and quickly so they can be tested with users
Conduct usability testing, communicating test results to the team and influencing the team to prioritize improvements based on the results
Produce quantitative and qualitative evidence to show that user experience is successful and improving
Create and maintain well-documented design patterns

user-research.title: User Research
descriptions: Use and work in team environments that use Agile methodologies (e.g., Scrum, Lean)
Lead groups to identify their target users and come to consensus about what needs to be learned
Identify, plan, coordinate and execute quantitative and qualitative research activities
Plan and conduct research in such a way as to get regular and frequent feedback from users and bring findings to bear iteratively on product development
Influence other product team members to participate in conducting research and interpreting findings
Effectively communicate research insights to team members and broader audiences verbally and through compelling artifacts such as user journey maps, personas or storytelling presentations
Make recommendations for product design and producing design ideas based on evidence
Influence a product team to prioritize user needs and make evidence-based decisions

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.isVendorBody: Get started by browsing the opportunities posted to the Digital Marketplace.
dashboard.isNotVendorBody: Get started by creating your first opportunity or browsing the opportunities posted to the Digital Marketplace.
dashboard.isVendorAlert: You must <1>Create Organization</1> and be a <3>Qualified Supplier</3> in order to submit proposals to Sprint With Us opportunities.

SignedOutMessageValid: You have successfully signed out. Thank you for using the Digital Marketplace.
SignedOutMessageNotValid: Signing out of the application failed.
title: Title
withdrawBeforeCWUproposalBody: Are you sure you want to withdraw your Code With Us proposal? You will still be able to resubmit your proposal prior to the opportunity's proposal deadline.
withdrawAfterCWUproposalBody: Are you sure you want to withdraw your Code With Us proposal? Your proposal will no longer be considered for this opportunity.
deleteCWUproposalBody: Are you sure you want to delete your Code With Us proposal? You will not be able to recover the proposal once it has been deleted.
emptyPageAlertText: Please save what you are working on
appTermsTitle: Digital Marketplace Terms & Conditions for E-Bidding
newAppTermsTextInfo: Please ensure you have reviewed the latest version of the
newAppTermsTextInfoCheck: I acknowledge that I have read, fully understand and agree to the <italic>{{appTermsTitle}}</italic>.
newAppTermsTextInfoCheckText: Also, make sure you have saved your work before continuing. Any unsaved information in forms will be lost.
newAddendumHelp: Provide additional information that was not provided on the original posting of the opportunity.
bodyModalPublishAddendum: Are you sure you want to publish this addendum? Once published, all subscribers will be notified.
bodyModalCancelBody: Are you sure you want to cancel? Any information you may have entered will be lost if you do so.

submitProposalTerms.title: Please ensure you have reviewed the
submitProposalTerms.titleSuite: prior to {{what}} your proposal for this {{type}} opportunity.
submitProposalTerms.checkboxText: I acknowledge that I have read, fully understand and agree to the <italic>{{title}}</italic>.

unableAddAddenda: Unable to add addenda due to a system error.
additionalAddendaInformation: Provide additional information here to clarify or support the information in the original opportunity.
draftOpportunityInfoAlert: This opportunity is a draft. Please select "Edit" from the Actions dropdown to complete and publish this opportunity.
modalPublishOpportunityBody: Are you sure you want to publish this opportunity? Once published, all subscribers will be notified.
modalPublishChangesOpportunityTitle: Publish Changes to Code With Us Opportunity?
modalPublishChangesOpportunityBody: Are you sure you want to publish your changes to this opportunity? Once published, all subscribers will be notified.
modalSuspendOpportunityBody: Are you sure you want to suspend this opportunity? Once suspended, all subscribers and vendors with pending or submitted proposals will be notified.
modalDeleteOpportunityBody: Are you sure you want to delete this opportunity? You will not be able to recover it once it has been deleted.
modalCancelNewOpportunityTitle: Cancel New Code With Us Opportunity?
modalCancelOpportunityBody: Are you sure you want to cancel this opportunity? Once cancelled, all subscribers and vendors with pending or submitted proposals will be notified.
isCWUOpportunityAcceptingProposals: Proposals will be displayed here once this opportunity has closed.
isNotCWUOpportunityAcceptingProposals: No proposals were submitted to this opportunity.
modalAwardOpportunityBody: Are you sure you want to award this opportunity to this vendor? Once awarded, all subscribers and vendors with submitted proposals will be notified accordingly.
overviewViewTitleHelp: Provide a brief and short title for the opportunity that highlights the work that you need done.
overviewViewTeaserHelp: Provide 1-2 sentences that will entice readers to apply to this opportunity and that describes what you are inviting them to do.
overviewViewTeaserPlaceHolder: Provide 1-2 sentences that describe to readers what you are inviting them to do.
overviewViewRemoteHelp: Indicate if the successful proponent may complete the work as outlined in the opportunity’s acceptance criteria remotely or not. If you select “yes”, provide further details on acceptable remote work options.
overviewViewRemoteYesPlaceHolder: Provide further information about this opportunity's remote work options.
overviewViewLocationHelp: Provide the location where you are located or where the work is expected to be completed.
overviewViewFixedPriceAwardHelp: To the best of your ability, estimate a fair price for the amount of work that you think it should take from the successful proponent to meet the opportunity’s acceptance criteria. It is suggested that you overestimate.
overviewViewFixedPriceAwardHelpPrice: The price estimate must not exceed {{maxBudget}}.
overviewViewRequiredSkillsHelp: Select the skill(s) from the list provided that the successful proponent must possess in order to be considered for the opportunity. If you do not see the skill that you are looking for, you may create a new skill by entering it into the field below.
descriptionViewHelp: Provide a complete description of the opportunity. For example, you may choose to include background information, a description of what you are attempting to accomplish by offering the opportunity, etc. You can format this description with Markdown.
detailsViewProposalDeadlineHelpP1: Choose a cut-off date for when proposals must be submitted by. The cut-off time is fixed to 4:00PM Pacific Time.
detailsViewProposalDeadlineHelpP2: A deadline of at least five (5) days from the date that the opportunity is published is recommended.
detailsViewAssignmentDateHelp: Choose a date that you will award the successful proponent the opportunity. The assignment date is fixed to 4:00PM Pacific Time.
detailsViewProposedStartDateHelp: Choose a date that you expect the successful proponent to begin the work as outlined in the opportunity’s acceptance criteria.
detailsViewCompletionDateHelp: Choose a date that you expect the successful proponent to meet the opportunity’s acceptance criteria.
detailsViewProjectSubmissionInfoHelp: Provide information on how the successful proponent may submit their work as outlined in the opportunity’s acceptance criteria (e.g. GitHub repository URL).
detailsViewAcceptanceCriteriaHelp: Clearly define what the successful proponent must deliver and all of the criteria that must be met in order for payment to be released. You can format this acceptance criteria with Markdown.
detailsViewEvaluationCriteriaPlaceHelpP1: Describe the criteria that you will use to score the submitted proposals. State the weight, or points, that you will give to each criterion (e.g. “Experience contributing Java code to any public code repositories with more than 5 contributors (10 points)”). You can format this evaluation criteria with Markdown.
detailsViewEvaluationCriteriaPlaceHelpP2: It is at your discretion which mandatory and weighted criteria you wish to use.
opportunityAttachmentsViewBody: Upload any supporting material for your opportunity here. Attachments must be smaller than 10MB.
createCwuOpportunityTitle: Create a Code With Us Opportunity
createCwuOpportunityDescriptionP1: <emph>Code With Us</emph> opportunities pay a fixed price of up to {{maxBudget}} for the delivery of code that meets your acceptance criteria.
createCwuOpportunityDescriptionP2: Use the form provided to create your <emph>Code With Us</emph> opportunity. You can either save a draft of your opportunity to complete the form at a later time, or you can complete the form now to publish your opportunity immediately.
createCwuOpportunityFooter: to learn how to create and manage a <emph>Code With Us</emph> opportunity.
createCwuOpportunityAlertActions: We were unable to {{alert}} your opportunity. Please fix the errors in the form below and try again.
infoDetailsHeading: To submit a proposal for this opportunity, you must possess the following skills:
noAttachementsMessage: There are currently no attachments for this opportunity.
noAddendaMessage: There are currently no addenda for this opportunity.
acceptanceCriteriaViewText: This is a fixed-price opportunity governed by the terms of our lightweight procurement model, Code With Us. To be paid the fixed price for this opportunity, you need to meet all of the following criteria:
proposalEvaluationCriteriaViewText: Your proposal will be scored using the following criteria:
CWUhowToApplyViewBodyP1-1: To submit a proposal for this Code With Us opportunity, you must have signed up for a Digital Marketplace vendor account.
CWUhowToApplyViewBodyP1-2: If you already have a vendor account, please
CWUhowToApplyViewBodyP2: Please note that you will not be able to submit a proposal if the opportunity's proposal deadline has passed.
alertSubmitProposalPush: You submitted a proposal to this opportunity on {{date}}.
headerCWUdescription: opportunities pay a fixed price for meeting acceptance criteria.
headerSprintWithUsDescription: opportunities are for registered organizations that can supply teams.
opportunityListIsNotificationsOn: Stop notifying me about new opportunities
noUnpublishedOpportunitiesFoundByCriteri: There are no unpublished opportunities that match your search criteria.
noUnpublishedOpportunitiesFound: There are no unpublished opportunities that match your search criteria.
noOpenOpportunitiesFoundByCriteria: There are no open opportunities that match your search criteria.
noOpenOpportunitiesFound: There are currently no open opportunities. Check back soon!
noClosedOpportunitiesFoundByCriteria: There are no closed opportunities that match your search criteria.
noClosedOpportunitiesFound: There are currently no closed opportunities.
userAccountRegisteredDescription: Thank you for creating an account for the Digital Marketplace web application.
inviteToRegisterTitle: {{legalName}} Has Sent You a Team Request
inviteToRegisterBodyP1: {{legalName}} Has requested that you join their team on the Digital Marketplace.
inviteToRegisterBodyP2: In order to join the organization's team you must first {{linkTo}} for a Digital Marketplace account. Once you have signed up, you can join their team and be included in proposals to Sprint With Us opportunities.
accountDeactivatedSummary: User account has been deactivated by the user.
accountDeactivatedBody: <paragraph>You have successfully deactivated your Digital Marketplace account.</paragraph><paragraph>You can reactivate your account by signing into the web application again.</paragraph>
accountDeactivatedAdminSummary: User account has been deactivated by an administrator.
accountDeactivatedAdminBody: <paragraph>Your Digital Marketplace account has been deactivated by an administrator.</paragraph><paragraph>You no longer have access to the web application.</paragraph><paragraph>If you have any questions, you can send an email to the Digital Marketplace administrators at {{linkTo}}.</paragraph>
accountReactivatedDescription: You have successfully reactivated your Digital Marketplace account.
accountReactivatedSummary: User account has been reactivated by the user.
accountReactivatedAdminSummary: User account has been reactivated by an administrator.
accountReactivatedAdminBody: <paragraph>Your Digital Marketplace account has been reactivated by an administrator.</paragraph><paragraph>If you have any questions, you can send an email to the Digital Marketplace administrators at {{linkTo}}.</paragraph>
waitForCodeChallengeBody: Participants will be displayed here once this opportunity has reached the Code Challenge.
codeChallengeBodyModal: Are you sure you want to complete the evaluation of this opportunity's Code Challenge? You will no longer be able to screen proponents in or out of the Team Scenario.
codeWithUsDescription: is a procurement mechanism for public sector organizations in {{regionNameLong}} to pay developers for code.
vendorsDescriptionP1: We know that there are tons of brilliant tech professionals like you who never get an opportunity to apply their skills to public service. We want to change that!
vendorsDescriptionP2: makes it easy to get paid for contributing to government’s digital services by providing a process that allows you to focus on writing code, not contract paperwork.
searchDescription: Find an opportunity that matches your skills and interest. The acceptance criteria describes what you need to deliver to get paid the fixed price.
connectDescription: Speak directly with the opportunity contact to get more clarity. If you have suggestions, or think the price is too low, say so!
applyDescription: Submit a proposal using the app. If you are awarded the opportunity, you will be offered the exclusive right to work on the issue for a set period of time.
contributeDescription: Work collaboratively and iteratively with the opportunity contact. Commit code early and often to ensure you are on the right track.
getPaidDescription: Once the acceptance criteria is met and your code is merged, submit your invoice and expect payment within 30 days. Read more about payment options
publicSectorDescriptionP1: If you manage an open source digital product in the {{regionNameLong}} public sector, <emphasis>Code With Us</emphasis> can help you access talented developers and pay for code quickly.
publicSectorDescriptionP2: Post an opportunity, evaluate proposals, assign a developer and get to work!
sprintWithUsDescription: is a procurement mechanism that allows the {{regionNameLong}} to procure Agile software development teams.
whatToExpectDescription: If your organization is awarded a Sprint With Us opportunity, here is what you can expect when you work with us:
governmentProductManagersDescription: You will work closely with a trained government product manager who has the expertise and the responsibility to run the service.
interdisciplinaryTeamsDescription: Your team will possess all the skills necessary for continuous delivery, such as DevOps engineering, front-end and back-end development, and user experience research and design.
openSourceDescription: Your team will own the code that's produced, but it will be published in GitHub under an open source license.
agileDescription: You will be adaptable to change and follow the Agile Scrum process, building and validating features iteratively with users.
agilePhasesDescription: Don’t expect lengthy requirements. This is Agile. You will start with Inception to understand the business problem, then build a Proof of Concept to demonstrate the feasibility of the solution. Finally, you will build out the rest of the product in Implementation.
pricingIncentivesDescription: These are not time & materials contracts! For each phase, you'll charge a fixed price for your interdisciplinary team to meet the deliverables for the time period. There's incentives to complete a phase early!
sprintWithUsHowToApplyViewBody: To apply for <emphasis>Sprint With Us</emphasis> opportunities, complete the following steps:
signInVendorAccount: Sign In to Your Vendor Account
signInVendorAccountDescription: to your Digital Marketplace Vendor account using {{idpName}}. If you do not yet have an account, you must
registerYourOrganizationDescriptionP1: Go to the <emphasis>Organizations</emphasis> page and click on the <bold>+ Create Organization</bold> button. Complete the form by providing all required information and submit.
registerYourOrganizationDescriptionP2: Similarly, you may register your organization via your user profile.
becomeQualifiedSupplierDescriptionP1: You must be considered a Qualified Supplier to apply for <emphasis>Sprint With Us</emphasis> opportunities.
becomeQualifiedSupplierDescriptionP2: To complete the qualification process, access your registered organization via your user profile and navigate to the <emphasis>SWU Qualification</emphasis> tab. Complete the requirements as provided to become a Qualified Supplier.
name: Name
accountIsActiveDescription: Deactivating {{your}} account means that {{you}} will no longer have access to the Digital Marketplace.
accountIsNotActiveDescription: Reactivate {{yourFull}} account to enable {{your}} access to the Digital Marketplace.
AdminDeactivatingUserModalBody: Are you sure you want to deactivate this user’s account? They will no longer be able to access the Digital Marketplace.
AdminReactivatingUserModalBody: Are you sure you want to deactivate your account? You will no longer be able to access the Digital Marketplace.
userDeactivatingSelfModalBody: Are you sure you want to deactivate your account? You will no longer be able to access the Digital Marketplace.
sprintWUcapabilitiesAndSkillsDescription: Sprint With Us opportunities require teams with the capabilities and skills shown below. Select the capabilities that you possess by clicking on their names or checkboxes. Let us know what you can do!
legalTermsDescription: In this section, you will find all of the policies, terms and agreements relevant to vendors of the Digital Marketplace.
privacyPolicyDescriptionP1: Your personal information is being collected by the Ministry of Citizens’ Services under s.26(c) of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act (FOIPPA). The collection, use and disclosure of your personal information is for the purpose of notifying, applying and awarding opportunities on the Digital Marketplace. If you have any questions, please contact: Zachary Woodward, Senior Director, Procurement, Ministry of Citizens’ Services,
privacyPolicyDescriptionP2: You agreed to the Digital Marketplace <italic>Privacy Policy</italic> when you created your Digital Marketplace account.
termsAndConditionsDescriptionP1: You agreed to the <italic>{{title}}</italic> on {{date}} at {{time}}.
notificationViewBody: Email notifications will be sent to <bold>{{email}}</bold> for the options selected below. If this email address is incorrect please update your profile.
isOwnedOrganisations: You are the owner of the following organizations:
isNotOwnedOrganisations: You do not own any organizations.
isAffilateOrganizations: You have given these companies permission to put you forward as a team member on proposals for opportunities.
isNotAffilateOrganizations: You are not affiliated with any organizations.
leaveOrganizationModalBody: Are you sure you want to leave this organization? You will no longer be able to be included as a team member in its opportunity proposals.
approveRequestModalBody: Approving this request will allow this company to put you forward as a team member on proposals for opportunities.
rejectRequestModalBody: Are you sure you want to reject this organization's request for you to join their team?
notFoundBody: The page you are looking for doesn't exist.
noticeIfdeactivatedOwnAccountBody: You have successfully deactivated your account.
noticeIfauthFailureBody: Please try again using the "Sign-In" button.
gotQuestionsBody: If you have questions about this opportunity, send an email to the Procurement team by clicking the "Contact" button below.
createCwuProposalBody: Use the form provided to create your proposal for this <emphasis>Code With Us</emphasis> opportunity. You can either save a draft of your proposal to complete the form at a later time, or you can complete the form now to submit your proposal immediately.
createCwuProposalFooter: to learn how to create and manage a <emph>Code With Us</emph> proposal.
modalCancelNewProposalTitle: Cancel New Code With Us Proposal?
legalNameHelp: Provide the first and last name of the individual that will complete the work as outlined in the opportunity’s acceptance criteria.
selectOrganizationHelp: Select the Organization that will complete the work as outlined in the opportunity's acceptance criteria.
selectOrganizationHintP1: If the organization you are looking for is not listed in this dropdown, please ensure that you have created the organization in
selectOrganizationHintP2: Also, please make sure that you have saved this proposal beforehand to avoid losing any unsaved changes you might have made.
proponentViewBody: Will you be submitting a proposal for this opportunity as an Individual or Organization?
proponentViewBodyActiveView: Please provide the following details for the proponent that will complete the work as outlined by the Acceptance Criteria of the opportunity.
proposalViewBody: Enter your proposal and any additional comments in the spaces provided below. Be sure to address the Proposal Evaluation Criteria.
proposalViewHelp: Provide your complete proposal here. Be sure to address the Proposal Evaluation Criteria as outlined on the opportunity. You can format your proposal with Markdown.
additionalCommentsHelp: Provide any additional information or comments that are relevant to your proposal submission. You can format your additional comments with Markdown.
proposalAttachmentsViewBody: Upload any supporting material for your proposal here. Attachments must be smaller than 10MB.

content-form.slugHelp: A page slug determines the URL that people will use to access the page. A valid slug must start with a lowercase character or number, and can subsequently contain lowercase characters, numbers or hyphens (i.e. "-"). For example, "this-is-a-valid-slug123".
content-form.HasNotSlugHint: This page will be available at

published.error-body: This page could not be published. Please fix the errors in the form, if any, and try again.
published.bodyHelp: Please enter the page's body in the provided text area. It can be formatted using Markdown.

deleted.error-body: This page could not be deleted.

changesPublished.error-body: Your changes to this page could not be published. Please fix the errors in the form, if any, and try again.

startedEditing.error-body: This page cannot be edited at this time. Please try again later.

notifiedNewTerms.success-body: All vendors have been notified that the <emphasis>{{appTermsTitle}}</emphasis> have been updated. They will now be prompted to accept the updated terms before submitting their next proposal to an opportunity.
notifiedNewTerms.error-body: The system was unable to notify vendors of the updated <emphasis>{{appTermsTitle}}</emphasis>. Please try again later.

contentModalPublishBody: Are you sure you want to publish this page? Once published, all users will be able to access it by navigating to its URL.
emptyPageAlertsWarning: This is a "fixed" page, which means this web app needs it to exist at a specific slug in order to function correctly. Consequently, this page cannot be deleted and its slug cannot be changed.
contentSaveChangesModal: Are you sure you want to publish your changes to this page? Once published, they will be visible to all users who navigate to this page's URL.
contentnotifyNewTermsChangesModalBody: Are you sure you want to notify all vendors of updated {{appTermsTitle}} Vendors will receive a notification email, and will be required to accept the new terms before continuing to submit proposals to opportunities.
contentDeleteModalBody: Are you sure you want to delete this page? It will no longer be accessible to users if you do.
programCardCWDdescription: Use a <emphasis>Sprint With Us</emphasis> opportunity to procure an Agile product development team for your digital service at a variable cost of up to {{maxBudget}}.
programCardSprintWUdescription: Use a <emphasis>Code With Us</emphasis> opportunity to pay a fixed price of up to {{maxBudget}} for the delivery of code that meets your acceptance criteria.

validateNumber.isMinText: Please enter {{article}} {{name}} greater than or equal to {{value}}
validateNumber.isMaxText: Please enter {{article}} {{name}} less than or equal to {{value}}

validateCWUOpportunityStatus.isNotValidCWU: "{raw}" is not a valid CodeWithUs opportunity status.

validateCWUProposalStatus.isNotValidCWU: "{raw}" is not a valid CodeWithUs proposal status.

isNotvalideSkills: Please select at least one skill.
invalidNumberWithPrecision: Please enter {{article}} {{name}} with precision less than or equal to {{maxPrecision}} decimal places.
invalidPhoneNumber: Please enter a valid phone number.
invalidCapability: Please select a capability from the list.

mailerNotifications.vendorTermsChangedTitle: Our Terms and Conditions Have Been Updated
mailerNotifications.vendorTermsChangedDescription: The Digital Marketplace Terms & Conditions for vendors have been updated.
mailerNotifications.vendorTermsChangedSummary: Vendor Terms & Conditions are updated; notify active vendors to re-accept
mailerNotifications.vendorTermsChangedBody: The updated Terms & Conditions must be reviewed and accepted prior to submitting proposals for Code-With-Us and Sprint-With-Us opportunities.
mailerNotifications.organizationArchivedBody: <paragraph>Your Digital Marketplace organization, {{legalName}}, has been archived by an administrator.</paragraph><paragraph>You will no longer be able to use this organization in the web application. </paragraph><paragraph>If you have any questions, you can send an email to the Digital Marketplace administrators at {{linkTo}}.</paragraph>
mailerNotifications.addedToTeamTitle: {{legalName}} Has Sent You a Team Request
mailerNotifications.addedToTeamBodyP1: {{legalName}} has requested that you join their team on the Digital Marketplace.
mailerNotifications.addedToTeamBodyP2: <paragraph>You can approve or reject your membership with {{legalName}} by using one of the buttons below.</paragraph><paragraph>If you approve the membership, you can be included as a team member on future Sprint With Us proposals submitted by {{legalName}}.</paragraph>
mailerNotifications.approvedRequestToJoinBody: <paragraph>{{memberName}} has approved your request to join {{organizationName}}'s team on the Digital Marketplace.</paragraph><paragraph>{{memberName}} can now be included in proposals submitted by {{organizationName}} to Sprint With Us opportunities.</paragraph>
mailerNotifications.rejectRequestToJoinBody: {{memberName}} has rejected your request to join {{organizationName}}'s team on the Digital Marketplace.
mailerNotifications.membershipCompleteBody: <paragraph>You are now a member of {{organizationName}}'s team on the Digital Marketplace</paragraph><paragraph>{{organizationName}} can now include you on proposals to  Sprint With Us opportunities.</paragraph>
mailerNotifications.memberLeavesBody: {{memberName}} has left {{organizationName}}'s team on the Digital Marketplace.  They will no longer be able to be included on proposals for Sprint With Us opportunities.
mailerNotifications.successfulCWUProposalSubmissionTitle: Your Code With Us Opportunity Proposal Has Been Submitted
mailerNotifications.successfulCWUProposalSubmissionDescripti: You have successfully submitted a proposal for the following Digital Marketplace opportunity:
mailerNotifications.successfulCWUProposalSubmissionBodyP2-1: If you would like to make changes to your proposal, simply
mailerNotifications.successfulCWUProposalSubmissionBodyP2-2: and access the proposal via your dashboard.  All changes must be submitted prior to the proposal deadline.
mailerNotifications.successfulCWUProposalSubmissionBodyP3: Once the proposal deadline has been reached, your proposal will be reviewed and assigned a score.  After all proposals have been evaluated, you will be notified if you have been awarded the opportunity or if your proposal was unsuccessful.
mailerNotifications.awardedCWUProposalSubmissionTitle: You Have Been Awarded a Code With Us Opportunity
mailerNotifications.awardedCWUProposalSubmissionDescription: Congratulations!  You have been awarded the following Digital Marketplace opportunity:
mailerNotifications.awardedCWUProposalSubmissionSummary: CWU opportunity awarded; sent to successful proponent.
mailerNotifications.awardedCWUProposalSubmissionBodyP1-1: If you would like to view your total score,
mailerNotifications.awardedCWUProposalSubmissionBodyP1-2: and access your proposal via your dashboard.
mailerNotifications.awardedCWUProposalSubmissionBodyP3: A member of the Digital Marketplace or the owner of the opportunity will be in touch with you shortly to discuss next steps.
mailerNotifications.unsuccessfulCWUProposalSubmissionTitle: A Code With Us Opportunity Has Closed
mailerNotifications.unsuccessfulCWUProposalSubmissionDescrip: The following Digital Marketplace opportunity that you submitted a proposal to has closed:
mailerNotifications.unsuccessfulCWUProposalSubmissionSummary: CWU opportunity awarded; sent to unsuccessful proponents.
mailerNotifications.unsuccessfulCWUProposalSubmissionBodyP1: The opportunity has been awarded to
mailerNotifications.unsuccessfulCWUProposalSubmissionBodyP3: Thank you for your submission and we wish you luck on the next opportunity.
mailerNotifications.disqualifiedCWUProposalSubmissionTitle: Your Code With Us Proposal Has Been Disqualified
mailerNotifications.disqualifiedCWUProposalSubmissionDescrip: The proposal that you submitted for the following Digital Marketplace opportunity has been disqualified:
mailerNotifications.withdrawnCWUProposalSubmissionProposalAu: Your proposal for the following Digital Marketplace opportunity has been withdrawn:
CWU proposal withdrawn; sent to proponent who has withdrawn.
If you would like to resubmit a proposal to the opportunity you may do so prior to the proposal deadline.
mailerNotifications.withdrawnCWUProposalSubmissionDescriptio: {{name}} has withdrawn their proposal for the following Digital Marketplace opportunity:
mailerNotifications.withdrawnCWUProposalSubmissionSummary: CWU proposal withdrawn; sent to the opportunity author.

opportunityNotExistText: The specified opportunity does not exist.
cannotSubscribeOwnOpportunityText: You cannot subscribe to your own opportunity.
userAlreadySubscribedOpportunityText: This user is already subscribed to this opportunity.
userIsntSubscribedOpportunityText: This user is not subscribed to this opportunity.
cwuOpportunityNotFound: Code With Us opportunity not found.
alreadyHaveProposalForOpprtunity: You already have a proposal for this opportunity.
proposalNotExistText: The specified proposal does not exist.
proposalDeleteIfNotDraftText: You can not delete a proposal that is not a draft.
slugInUseText: This slug is already in use.
contentNotExistText: The specified content does not exists.
slugWithFixedContentChangeText: You cannot change the slug of fixed content.
invalidateRequestBody: You need to submit a valid multipart request to create a file.
